author: sibkatya
content: <@845691100072509460>, we discussed with <@586161934425128960> and <@1122553751983628349>  that it doesn't make sense for us to duplicate the same metrics on both the CL and EL sides. We can monitor Engine API values on the CL side. Like unsatisfied blocks, sent/received transactions, etc. These APIs are quite robust. It means if the request succeeded, we will get the same number of txns on EL that were sent from CL. If not, we will catch the request failures on the CL side. It makes sense to monitor only EL specific metrics like validation failures, gas related metrics, etc. Let us know if you have any other concerns on this. If anyone disagrees, please, speak up.

author: jih2nn
content: Thanks for sharing! It sounds right. Which execution metrics does it leave then?

author: jih2nn
content: I don't have the number but I'd expect it'd be very short
